label: Description
value: Presented by Mr. George B. Palmer ( Netherlands, 1959)

label: Description
value: Each earring with circular ornament in open-daisy design from which hangs a fantastic figure (head and upper body, human with wings and feet of a bird).

label: Dimensions
value: L x W x D (each): 5 x 1.7 x 1 cm (1 15/16 x 11/16 x 3/8 in.)

label: Description
value: Bag probably made from pieces of older textiles. Blue silk edged with silk cord and a tassel with appliquéd pieces of metallic cloth with embroidery.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and metallic thread embroidery on silk foundation Technique: embroidered on satin foundation
Design for a Woven Horizontal Border

label: Description
value: A white and blue border of hanging ears of grain is at the bottom. Tulip boughs rise from it in great intervals; one and part of another are shown. Flower bunches including some roses, and a big bough of a bush, rise in the intervals.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on oily tracing paper

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt, New York, NY; 1920: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

Design for a Woven Border of the "Fabrique de St. Ruf"

label: Description
value: The rising waves of an undulating band which have blossoms at their bases are completed to form circles. Falling water and bead chains are shown in them. Over the falling waves stand fountains with springing water and water pouring over the rims. From behind the basin rise boughs with bell-flowers. The units of either motif are shown.

value: Brush and blue, white, and purple gouache on oily tracing paper

label: Provenance
